results.title: Technology and the city : foundation for a smart nation
abstracts: In this book, the authors provide the milestones in Singapore's journey in developing and leveraging info-communications technology (ICT) over the past fifty years. They also discuss how Singapore has utilised ICT to improve the lives of Singapore citizens, and to position itself as a global business hub.

results.title: CTLT 2015 program and abstract book
abstracts: This is the programme and abstract book of the Global Conference on Teaching and Learning with Technology (CTLT) 2015, held in Singapore. It provides information on the programme of the Conference, as well as the abstracts of the conference papers. The conference is organised by Asia Pacific International Academy, a subsidiary of Aventis School of Management.

results.title: Digital signal processing in experimental research. Vol. 3. How to optimally sample and resample images : theory and methods
abstracts: This is publication is for engineers and technicians involved in imaging engineering and related applications, as well as engineering students learning digital signal processing techniques. It provides updated formulations of image sampling theory and practical algorithms of image sampling. It also introduces error-free interpolation image resampling methods. These processes will aid in the understanding of what make analog to digital signal conversion efficient for modern imaging devices.

results.title: Recent advances in signal transduction research and therapy. Vol. 1
abstracts: This book reviews recent advances in select cancer signal transduction pathways that have been targeted or could be potential targets for developing therapeutics for cancers. It provides updates on clinical information about signal transduction to prevent or treat life-threatening diseases such as cancer. This issue covers topics on a specific cancer type, coverage of multiple cancer types and coverage of signaling pathways.

results.title: Marine ecotoxicology bimonitoring made easy : six biomarker assays for the citizen scientist
abstracts: This book is a product of a collaborative project between the National Parks Board, Singapore and National Institute of Education (NIE). The book provides specific information and instructions on the application of six biomarker assays and the study of effect of environmental stressors on the health of organisms in the natural environment.

results.title: Emerging technologies in agriculture and food science
abstracts: This book presents reviews on innovative techniques, scientific estimations and methodologies to enhance agricultural sustainability, effectiveness and plant health, with the aim of complementing conventional plant control and breeding to increase crop yield and production.

results.title: Recent advances in renewable energy. Vol. 4, Solar chimney power plants : numerical investigations and experimental validation
abstracts: This book is a study on the effect of geometrical parameters on the airflow behavior inside a solar chimney power plant. It covers simulation using CFD software ANSYS Fluent, a numerical study on alternate geometric configurations of the solar chimney power plant, and the study of an experimental prototype to determine factors affecting the performance of the solar chimney power plant such as environmental temperature and air velocity.

results.title: Core curriculum
abstracts: This book, published by Solve Education!, provides a curriculum to support the company's objective of increasing marginalised young people's learning motivations and provide them with the necessary skills, so that they are able to enter the workforce and transform their lives. The target audience are children and youth who are not able to gain access to quality education.

results.title: Learn by creating with TinyTap
abstracts: In this book the author shows teachers how TinyTap, an app available on both iOs and Android platforms, can be used to create  games which can then be used in teaching subjects and topics including numbers and alphabets, biology and spelling.

results.title: Transactions of ISATE : the 11th International Symposium on Advances in Technology Education, Ngee Ann Polytechnic, 19- 22 Sept 2017
abstracts: "The 11th International Symposium on Advances in Technology Education (ISATE) provides a platform for educators from higher education institutions to share their knowledge and experiences in practice-based engineering and technology education. Through the Symposium, stakeholders can benefit from sharing innovative teaching methodologies and practices used in schools"--P. 1.

results.title: Selected papers from the Asian Education Technology Conference (AETC2016)
abstracts: This contains selected papers from The Asian Education Technology Conference 2016 which was held at Holiday Inn Singapore on 29-30 November 2016. In these papers educators share their experiences on the creation and dissemination of knowledge related to the use of information technology in education.

results.title: Empathetic technology for ageing : rethinking health and wellness for the elderly in Singapore : Infocomm Technology Sector
abstracts: This book, published by DesignSingapore Council, explores the uses of technologies to improve the lives of the elderly in Singapore, in areas such as healthcare and social engagement.

results.title: How to save $$ on inkjet printing
abstracts: This is an ebook written by David Chee, an inventor who specialises in green products, on his research and evaluation of various inkjet cartridges and their refilling methods.

results.title: Simplify, automate, liberate! : scripting tips for Unix/Linux system administrators
abstracts: This book is written by the author for intermediate system administrators, as well as new administrators, for them to learn scripting which will help in their work.

results.title: Introduction to Sensors in IoT and Cloud Computing Applications
Nondestructive evaluation of agro-products by intelligent sensing techniques
abstracts: This book focuses on intelligent sensing techniques in the nondestructive evaluation of agro-products and describes existing and innovative techniques that could be or have been applied to agro-products’ quality and safety evaluation, processing, harvest, traceability, etc.

results.title: Principles of qualitative inorganic analysis : precipitation, separation and identification of cations
abstracts: This book is divided into ten chapters. First chapter describes the method and laboratory safety. Second chapter includes an explanation of the basic principles of qualitative analysis. 3-8 chapters cover several topics that are important in understanding how a particular analytical method works for diagnosing cations in samples, starting from sedimentation and ending with the identification. The ninth chapter includes a summary of diagnosing cations with some given questions about all chapters. Finally, the book concludes with many important tables and information for both students and researchers.

results.title: Hydraulic power plants : a textbook for engineering students
abstracts: This book describes the construction of hydraulic power plants and contains a large number of drawings and charts. It also includes the most important specification and working examples and solved problems, which can be applied in designing and maintenance of hydroelectric power plants, pumping stations and pump installation.

results.title: Current and future developments in proteomics. Vol. 1. Microbial proteomics : development in technologies and applications
abstracts: This compilation contains a collection of chapters on recent development on microbial proteomics related to technologies and diseases and its application to combat the microbes related to current issues, especially on antimicrobial resistance and M.tuberculosis.

results.title: Diabetes : current and future developments. Vol 2. Diabetes and the eye : latest concepts and practices
abstracts: This book addresses a wide range of topics in a highly scientific and easy to read format on the commonly encounter diabetic eye disorders. It aims to aid in the current understanding of ocular manifestations of diabetes and to serve as a resource for practicing ophthalmologists and other physicians who manage diabetes.

results.title: Catalysis : current and future developments. Vol. 1. Fundamentals and prospects of catalysis
abstracts: This is a reference guidebook on catalysis, an important research area in the field of chemical sciences. The field of catalysis is interdisciplinary by nature as it includes organic synthesis, coordination and organometallic chemistry, kinetics and mechanism, stereochemical concepts and material science. The commercial products obtained via the various catalytic processes are valuable. Hence, catalysis development and understanding is important at many levels.

results.title: Frontiers in cardiovascular drug discovery. Vol. 5
abstracts: This book provides updates on the latest advances in cardiovascular drug design and discovery. It presents reviews on various drug targets and new classes of therapies for the prevention or treatment of cardiovascular diseases.

results.title: Enzymes involved in glycolysis, fatty acid and amino acid biosynthesis : active site mechanisms and inhibition
abstracts: This book provides insights into the reaction mechanism between enzymes in biosynthetic pathways and how transformation occurs within the cell. The understanding of the interaction leads to the emergence of inhibitors used for the treatment of diseases such as cancer, tuberculosis, diabetes and obesity. This knowledge will serve professionals in the pharmaceutical, health and food industries.

results.title: Frontiers in natural product chemistry, v. 6
abstracts: This is volume 6 of Frontiers in natural product chemistry. It presents recent advances in the chemistry and biochemistry of naturally occurring compounds, including research on natural substances of land and sea, as well as plants, microbes and animals.

results.title: Frontiers in nanobiotechnology. Vol. 1. Advances in biosensing technology for medical diagnosis
abstracts: Advances in biosensing technology for medical diagnosis is a reference book for healthcare providers and biomedical engineers. It provides information about the diagnostic applications of biosensors for different diseases including infectious diseases and neurodegenerative diseases. This book aims to guide them in tailoring different biosensing techniques for specific diagnostic procedures.

results.title: Liquid crystal light modulators
abstracts: This book provides reports in the field of liquid crystal material studies as well as aspects of technology and design in the manufacturing of advanced liquid crystal light modulators.

results.title: Applications of NMR spectroscopy. Vol. 8
abstracts: This book provides updates on the latest advances in application of nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR) spectroscopy in various fields of organic chemistry, biochemistry, health and agriculture. This issue contains information of NMR based analysis of common sugars, plant based constituents, nucleic acids and proteins, NMR- based metabolomics, as well as MRI for the diagnosis of chronic and acute health disorders.

results.title: Frontiers in computational chemistry. Vol. 5
abstracts:
This book presents contemporary research on molecular modeling techniques used in drug discovery and the drug development process. It focuses on the application of computational
chemistry approaches to biological and organic processes.

results.title: Frontiers in ceramic science. Vol. 3. Applications of advanced ceramics in science, technology, and medicine
abstracts:
This book provides updates on the various advanced ceramic materials and the applications in distinct fields, such as actuators, energy storage, environmental, 3D printing, electronics, biomedical and EMI shielding. It provides overviews on advanced ceramic materials and their derived composites, basic research and application and explores
challenges and future directions of advanced ceramic materials.

results.title: Differential and integral calculus : theory and cases
abstracts: This is an introductory textbook for first year differential and integral calculus, covering the fundamentals related to this discipline, such as the family of functions, the sequences and series, and the composition of functions. Each chapter provides many examples, exercises and case studies.

results.title: Essential techniques for medical and life scientists : a guide to contemporary methods and current applications with the protocols. Part 2
abstracts: This second volume focuses on imaging chemical identification methods and emission spectroscopy, along with a calorimetric method and their applications in modern biological sciences and medical research programmes. This book is designed for scientists who wish to use distinct applications for their experimental set-up.

results.title: Nanomaterials and their interactive behavior with biomolecules, cells and tissues
abstracts: This book comprises of ten chapters with each chapter discusses on specific aspects of nanotechnology and nanoscience, and their interactions with biomolecules and biological systems. There is also brief discussion on the definitions, and the applications of nanotechnology in the different fields, but specifically to biological sciences and materials sciences. It also provides an overview of the various aspects of interactions and presented examples supporting the concepts being discussed.

results.title: Cutting edge techniques in biophysics, biochemistry and cell biology : from principle to applications
abstracts: This book presents an overview of basic applications and analytical techniques in biophysics, biochemistry and cell biology, as well as their potential applications in biomedical research. Areas covered include in-vitro cell culture techniques, real-time PCR based disease diagnosis and X-ray crystallography.

results.title: Rethinking database rights and data ownership in an AI world
authors: Singapore Academy of Law. Law Reform Committee
abstracts: This report analyses the legal issues regarding the control/rights over the "big data" databases in the new and emerging Artificial Intelligence (AI) technologies, and to ensure data contributor's retaining appropriate level of control and access to the data. It also provides recommendations on copyright protection of computer-generated works.

results.title: Applying ethical principles for artificial intelligence in regulatory reform
authors: Singapore Academy of Law. Law Reform Committee
abstracts: The report considers core ethical principles and assess their implications and challenges, to assist stakeholders in adopting best practices in incorporating the principles in the development, deployment and usage of the AI systems.

results.title: Modern intelligent instruments : theory and application
abstracts: This book introduces the main principles and applications of modern measurement and intelligent instruments. Consisting of 10 chapters, it discusses various aspects of intelligent instruments such as in circuit signal and system, data processing technology, performance analysis, signal processing, and human-computer interaction. It also provides applications of the intelligent instrument in somatosensory networks, robots and equipment status.

results.title: Applications of modern mass spectrometry. Vol. 1
abstracts: This book comprises of five review articles on applications of mass spectrometry in various fields, such as animal nutrition, environmental analysis, forensic sciences and explosives. Each article presents case studies of the use of mass spectrometric tools and discusses their strengths and limitations, with a common underlying theme of analysing and identifying proteins and peptides.

results.title: Diabetes : current and future developments. Vol. 1. Kidney disease in diabetes
abstracts: This book covers the latest developments in the field of research in diabetic kidney disease and its treatment. The book also looks at the growing problem of obesity, and how it contributes to the rise of diabetes, hypertension and cardiovascular disease in the developed world.

results.title: How to design optimization algorithms by applying natural behavioral patterns
abstracts: This book is aimed at students and young people. It introduces the concept of optimisation, which is the search for the best answer to complex mathematical problems. To deal with challenging optimisation problems, the authors propose that new nature-inspired algorithms be developed, in the believe that nature is a great source of inspiration and important mechanisms can be found in the mysteries of nature. Most of the algorithms that used the natural resource were able to create a suitable framework under an optimization algorithm.

results.title: Planetary habitability in binary systems
abstracts: This book contains a brief overview of the various types of double star-planet configurations that have been observed so far. It also discusses the variety of planetary motion in such environments. An explanation of the new methodologies developed in this area of research is included.

results.title: Cooling energy solutions for buildings and cities
abstracts: This book addresses the problem of the future cooling energy demand, the global frame defining the actual and future cooling energy consumption in the building sector. A model was developed to predict the future cooling energy consumption of both the residential and commercial sector. The book also presents low energy, high-performance technological solutions for cooling energy problem in buildings and at the city level.

results.title: Design-basis accident analysis methods for light-water nuclear power plants
abstracts: This book presents the principles of safety evaluation as practiced in the regulated light-water reactor nuclear industry. It covers the common topics of modeling and simulation, methods supporting the basis for the underlying assumptions, the extension to radiological safety, what to expect in a licensing review, historical perspectives and the implication for new designs.

results.title: Food additives and human health
abstracts: This volume assesses food additives to be a valuable tool for their rational and safe use and provides an insight into the impact of food additives on human health.

results.title: Numerical methods and implementation in geotechnical engineering. Pt. 1
abstracts: This book covers finite element method, optimization method, plasticity based slip line method, limit analysis method, distinct element method, Smoothed-Particle Hydrodynamics Method, Spectral Element Method and Material Point Method. It also attempts to explain the methods of implementation of some these methods using sample computer programmes.

results.title: The factors of organic evolution
abstracts: This volume contains the author's opinions and views of evolution. His arguments presented contain bearings on psychology, ethics and sociology.

results.title: Stress response and immunity : links and trade offs
abstracts: This volume deals with how organisms integrate responses to constantly changing environments and to protect themselves from pathogens. Organisms included in this book are bacteria and archaea.

results.title: An update on airway management
abstracts: Airway management is one of the pillars of anaesthesiology and critical care in various scheduled, urgent, or emergent situations. This volume provides an update of the various methods of airway management, covering preoxygenation, apneic oxygenation, and prevention of distortion; radiology, tomography and ultrasonography; supraglottic airway devices; and bibliometrics of the difficult airway.

results.title: Singapore Learning Design and Technology Conference 2019 : programme & abstract book
abstracts: This contains the programme and abstract book of the Singapore Learning Design and Technology Conference 2019 held on 1-2 August 2019. Papers presented cover topics on design thinking as a strategy in general education revision, assessment and the impact of pedagogical space design on collaborative learning in tertiary education.

results.title: Monitoring artificial materials and microbes in marine ecosystems : interactions and assessment methods
abstracts:
This volume deals with monitoring artificial materials and microbes in marine ecosystems. It covers coral reef ecosystems in marine environments, biofilm on materials’ surfaces in marine
environments and the effect of metallic nanoparticle-dispersed silane-based polymer coatings on anti-biofilm formation.

results.title: 圆周运动的时空效应
abstracts: 这是一篇关于圆周运动的时空效应的课题. 作者在文中提及牛顿引力、数学以及物理等等的理论.

results.title: Singapore Learning Design and Technology Conference 2019 : conference proceedings
abstracts: This contains four papers presented at the Singapore Learning Design and Technology Conference 2019 held on 1-2 August 2019. The papers cover topics on enabling students to learn hands-on technical skills using Makerspace and diversification of study materials with regard to student's abilities.

results.title: Singapore Conference on Applied Psychology 2019 : programme & abstract book
abstracts: The Singapore Conference on Applied Psychology 2019 was held on 20 and 21 June 2019. It contains the conference schedule and the abstracts of papers presented.

results.title: Compendium on cardiomyopathies : basic, therapeutics, and perspectives
abstracts: Cardiomyopathy is a pathogenetic group of diseases affecting the heart muscle. This volume explores pathophysiological mechanisms from genetics, molecular biology, electrophysiology, invasive and non-invasive cardiology, imaging methods as well as surgery. It also covers important imaging methods including echocardiography and cardiac magnetic imaging. A presentation of the current state of cardiomyopathies from genetics to management to cardiologists, cardiovascular intensivists and cardiac emergency specialists is included.

results.title: Protocols used in molecular biology
abstracts: This volume contains recent and advance molecular biology protocols including introductions, materials and chemicals required, procedures, trouble shooting tips and applications of the protocols.

results.title: Frontiers in anti-infective agents. V. 1, Current perspectives on anti-infective agents
abstracts: This volume presents current perspectives on anti-infective agents. It covers topics on protozoan and helminth infections: epidemiology and anti infective therapy, therapeutic drugs used for effective lifelong control of HIV and aids and drugs for superbugs.

results.title: Recent advances in Alzheimer research. Vol. 3, Alzheimer disease : pathological and clinical findings
abstracts:
This book contains information on different aspects of Alzheimer's disease including amyloid hypothesis, symptoms, pain, dysphagia, neuroimaging, brain connectivity, treatment, nutrition and palliative care. The target audience of this book include students, physicians,
internists, patients and their families.

results.title: Sex steroids and apoptosis in skeletal muscle : molecular mechanisms
abstracts: This book aims to present the role of sex hormones in skeletal muscle in a new light. It contains information on sarcopenia and its relation with apoptosis and studies the cellular and molecular mechanisms underlying age-linked changes in the skeletal muscles emphasising on the role of satellite cells.

results.title: Herbal medicine : back to the future. Vol. 2, Vascular health
abstracts: This volume presents researches on the use of herbal medicine in vascular health. These include plants used against cardiovascular diseases, herbal products found useful in hypertension, prevention and treatment of obesity-related cardiovascular diseases, and herbal agent for the treatment of ischemic myocardial disorders.

results.title: Nitrogen removal processes for wastewater treatment
abstracts: This volume discusses conventional method and technology of nitrogen removal from water; presents conventional biological method for nitrogen removal; introduces food industry wastewater treatment from nitrogen compounds; and covers a new approach towards environmental pollution remediation biotechnology by different types of Bio Electrochemical Systems (BES).

results.title: Current and future developments in food science. Vol. 1, Advances in the determination of xenobiotics in foods
abstracts: Xenobiotics in food has been a cause for concern in food. At present much attention is on those from food chain residues. This volume  presents some recent advances and developments achieved in the determination of different xenobiotics in foods.

results.title: Herbal medicine : back to the future. Vol. 3, Cancer therapy
abstracts: This book contains information on the use of sophisticated methods to explore traditional medicine in treating cancer. Its target audience include pharmaceutical scientists and postgraduate students seeking updated information on natural product chemistry and pharmacology.

results.title: Evaluation of environmental contaminants and natural products : a human health perspective
abstracts: This volume contains an valuation of environmental contaminants and natural products from a human health perspective. It covers topics on sources and effects of environmental contaminants and their sources as well as the role of phytoconstituents in modulating xenobiotic metabolism and potential health benefits of nutraceuticals for human health.

results.title: Research and design of snow hydrology sensors and instrumentation : selected research papers
abstracts: This book contains eight research papers authored by Dr. Raman K. Attri. It discusses key electronics and mechanical design principles, used in designing sensors and instrumentation systems. The author also highlights some of the design challenges faced.

results.title: Soh's walkthrough for secondary chemistry (Singapore) : a short guide to N and O level combined science chemistry and O level chemistry
abstracts: This book contains information on topics in chemistry, useful for secondary school students sitting for "N" and "O" level examinations. Questions are posed at the end of each topic. There are also two chapters with consolidated questions for the entire year's syllabus.

results.title: A psychological guide to the absolute authority of the word of God
abstracts: In this book the author attempts to further the understanding of the teachings of the Holy Bible using a psychological perspective. He re-looks at some aspects of psychology from the Christian perspective and investigates the psychological impact of the Word of God on personal daily lives. This book is suitable for the non-academic reader

results.title: 圆周运动的时空效应
abstracts: 作者阐明圆周运动的时空效应, 也引用了众科、数学家如高斯与牛顿的定律和理论、

results.title: Little climate : we need to talk about climate disruption
abstracts: This is a cartoon book about climate change. Based on the United Nations climate reports and published scientific papers, these cartoons take the reader through the science of climate disruption, our predicted futures, positive progress that we can already see, and showcase solutions and opportunities.

results.title: Towards an enhanced occupational health and safety model for dental professionals : a dissertation
abstracts: The work aims to develop an occupational health and safety model for dental professionals based on level of awareness and degree of compliance. 226 dental professionals including dentists, dental laboratory technicians and dental hygienists from the National Capital Region, Cebu and Davao participated in the study. The conclusion is that increasing awareness of dental professionals to occupational health and safety standards is a must.

results.title: Developing a standard mesh diagram for Filipino : a dissertation
abstracts: In this dissertation the author presents his study that was conducted at Centro Escolar University Manila, Philippines in Advance Orthodontic department. He attempts to develop a mesh diagram using Filipino specific norms. Mesh diagrams are being used to study facial imbalance and harmony together with proportional analysis which is a major concept in orthodontics.

results.title: Love to code. V. 1, Microsoft MakeCode edition
abstracts: This is part of Love to Code kit. It teaches children basic coding using a Chibi Chip. Children will learn to turn on LEDs, programme LEDs to blink, make paper switches, fade LEDs on and off and debug a project.

results.title: Singapore Conference on Applied Psychology 2017 : SCAP programme & abstract book
abstracts: This publication for Singapore Conference on Applied Psychology 2017, held on 29 and 30 June 2017, is divided into "programme" and "abstract". It contains the conference schedule and abstracts of the papers presented.

results.title: Singapore Conference on Applied Psychology 2016 : programme & abstract book
authors: NIL:Singapore Conference on Applied Psychology (2016 : Singapore)
abstracts: This publication for Singapore Conference on Applied Psychology 2016, held on 14th and 15th June 2016, is divided into "programme" and "abstract". It contains the conference schedule, and abstracts of the papers presented.

results.title: The separation of waters
abstracts: Through this graphic novel, Milton Choo tries to explain the events that happened on the first six days of Genesis, with scientific explanations.

results.title: 2015 WS Asian Congress of Applied Psychology : ACAP 2015 program and abstract book
abstracts: This is the programme and abstract book of the 2015 WS Asian Congress of Applied Psychology, held in Singapore. It provides information on the programme of the Conference, as well as the abstracts of the conference papers. The conference is organised by Asia Pacific International Academy, a subsidiary of Aventis School of Management.

results.title: Search engine advertising for entrepreneurs
abstracts: This book, published by Healy Consultants, provides information on search engine advertising for entrepreneurs. The book is the result of the company's research and its own experience in search engine advertising strategies, in the last six years.

results.title: Nutritional immunology on the performance of pig production : technical review
abstracts: This book is written to provide the readers with a better understanding of how nutritional immunology will benefit the production of pigs.

results.title: Amazing : celebrating 40 successful years in Singapore (1970-2010)
abstracts: This is a publication by HP (Hewlett-Packard) Singapore, to commemorate the company's 40 years in operations in Singapore, from 1970 to the present.

results.title: Computer applications : 2014 syllabus
abstracts: This is a publication by the Computer Education Unit, Curriculum Planning & Development Division, Ministry of Education, on the syllabus for Computer Applications for Secondary level, for the year 2014.

results.title: Advancing collaborative learning with ICT : conception, cases and design
abstracts:
This monograph is written with the intent to advance collaborative learning (CoL) with information and communication technologies (ICT) in Singapore schools. As group work becomes a common approach to learn in today’s
classrooms, this monograph aims to seed ideas on how group work can be characterised as collaboration.

results.title: Self-directed learning with ICT : theory, practice and assessment
abstracts:
This monograph about Self-Directed Learning (SDL) is written with the Singapore educational context in mind, particularly within the context of formal schooling. It also explores the use of information and communication
technologies (ICT) when promoting SDL in different learning scenarios.

results.title: The Advanced Technology Program [electronic resource] : challenges and opportunities / Charles W. Wessner, editor ; [Board on Science, Technology, and Economic Policy, National Research Council].
abstracts: "Government-industry partnerships"--Cover.
Includes bibliographical references (p. 119-122).

results.title: Media and new capitalism in the digital age : the spirit of networks / Eran Fisher.
abstracts: This book explores the new terrain of network capitalism through the transformations of the discourse on technology. Rather than viewing such discourse as either a true or false reflection of reality, Fisher evaluates the ideological role that technology discourse plays in the legitimation of a new form of capitalism. Based on an extensive empirical analysis, the book argues that contemporary technology discourse at one and the same time promises more personal empowerment through network technology and legitimates a more privatized, flexible, and precarious economic constellations. Such discourse signals a new tradeoff in the political culture of capitalism, from a legitimation discourse which emphasizes the capacity of technology and technique to bring about social emancipation (through equality, stability, and security) to a legitimation discourse which focuses on the capacity of technology to bring about individual emancipation (through individual empowerment, authenticity, creativity, and cooperation). Contrary to the prevailing assumption that sees network technology as liberating from the rigidity and pitfalls of a stifling, Fordist capitalism, the book offers a theoretical framework which sees contemporary technology discourse as an ideology that legitimates the economic, social, and political arrangements of the new capitalism.

results.title: The Advanced Technology Program : challenges and opportunities / Charles W. Wessner, editor ; [Board on Science, Technology, and Economic Policy, National Research Council].
abstracts: "Government-industry partnerships"--Cover.
Includes bibliographical references (pages 119-122).

results.title: Mediating the human body [electronic resource] : technology, communication, and fashion / edited by Leopoldina Fortunati, James E. Katz, Raimonda Riccini.
abstracts: Discussing a wide array of topics on how the body and technology interact, this work aims to improve our understanding of the experience of body as it is mediated among competing forces and intellectual domains. The perspectives include literary analysis and speculative interpretations.

results.title: Media and new capitalism in the digital age [electronic resource] : the spirit of networks / Eran Fisher.
abstracts: This book explores the new terrain of network capitalism through the transformations of the discourse on technology. Rather than viewing such discourse as either a true or false reflection of reality, Fisher evaluates the ideological role that technology discourse plays in the legitimation of a new form of capitalism. Based on an extensive empirical analysis, the book argues that contemporary technology discourse at one and the same time promises more personal empowerment through network technology and legitimates a more privatized, flexible, and precarious economic constellations. Such discourse signals a new tradeoff in the political culture of capitalism, from a legitimation discourse which emphasizes the capacity of technology and technique to bring about social emancipation (through equality, stability, and security) to a legitimation discourse which focuses on the capacity of technology to bring about individual emancipation (through individual empowerment, authenticity, creativity, and cooperation). Contrary to the prevailing assumption that sees network technology as liberating from the rigidity and pitfalls of a stifling, Fordist capitalism, the book offers a theoretical framework which sees contemporary technology discourse as an ideology that legitimates the economic, social, and political arrangements of the new capitalism.

results.title: Reinventing discovery : the new era of networked science / Michael Nielsen.
abstracts: "In Reinventing discovery, Michael Nielsen argues that we are living at the dawn of the most dramatic change in science in more than 300 years. This change is being driven by powerful new cognitive tools, enabled by the internet, which are greatly accelerating scientific discovery. There are many books about how the internet is changing business or the workplace or government. But this is the first book about something much more fundamental: how the internet is transforming the nature of our collective intelligence and how we understand the world. Reinventing Discovery tells the exciting story of an unprecedented new era of networked science. We learn, for example, how mathematicians in the Polymath Project are spontaneously coming together to collaborate online, tackling and rapidly demolishing previously unsolved problems. We learn how 250,000 amateur astronomers are working together in a project called Galaxy Zoo to understand the large-scale structure of the Universe, and how they are making astonishing discoveries, including an entirely new kind of galaxy. These efforts are just a small part of the larger story told in this book--the story of how scientists are using the internet to dramatically expand our problem-solving ability and increase our combined brainpower. This is a book for anyone who wants to understand how the online world is revolutionizing scientific discovery today--and why the revolution is just beginning"-- Provided by publisher.

results.title: Technology entrepreneurship [electronic resource] : creating, capturing, and protecting value / Thomas N. Duening, Robert D. Hisrich, Michael A. Lechter.
abstracts: Recognizing the unique needs of the technology startup, Duening focuses on intellectual property development, funding, and marketing/selling more than other texts in this market. Extensive use of technology examples, case studies, and assignments keeps the book relevant and motivating for engineering students. A full supplements package, including instructor manual and lecture notes, makes it easy to get the course up and running. * rich in case studies, examples, and in-chapter elements that focus on the challenges of launching and operating a technolog.

results.title: Process innovation : reengineering work through information technology / Thomas H. Davenport.
abstracts: Includes bibliographical references and index.

abstracts: Includes bibliographical references and index.

abstracts: Includes bibliographical references and index.

results.title: Realizing the information future : the Internet and beyond / NRENAISSANCE Committee, Computer Science and Telecommunications Board, Commission on Physical Sciences, Mathematics, and Applications, National Research Council.
abstracts: Presents the full text of "Realizing the information future: the Internet and beyond," a report from the Nrenaissance Committee. Includes a preface, an executive summary, a list of Committee members, and a press release regarding the report. Offers access to a PostScript version of the report. Examines the possibility of an integrated national information infrastructure for the United States and its uses for educational institutions and libraries, as well as financial issues and the government's role. Contains sample principal sets and definitions of key terms. Notes that the project was approved by the Governing Board of the National Research Council, whose members are drawn from the councils of the National Academy of Sciences (NAS), the National Academy of Engineering (NAE), and the Institute of Medicine (IOM). Links to the home pages of the NAS and the NAP.
